definition: to lend an arm to support sb
to take by the arm and assist/to mix/to blend/to dilute/to adulterate
to support with the hand/to help sb up/to support oneself by holding onto something/to help

sentences.english: The old man stood up, supported by his son.
sentences.chinese: 這位老人由他兒子攙扶着站了起來。

sentences.english: She stood up first so as to help the old lady off the bus.
sentences.chinese: 爲了攙扶那位老奶奶下車，她先站了起來。

sentences.english: Gene Bonti helps his wife Bobbie down steps into the couple's family room.
sentences.chinese: 吉恩攙扶妻子博比下樓梯去休息室。

sentences.english: The little boy is always willing to help the old man along when he crosses the street.
sentences.chinese: 這個小男孩總是樂於在那位老人過馬路時攙扶着他走。

sentences.english: The old man stood up supported by his son.
sentences.chinese: 老人由其兒子攙扶着站了起來。

sentences.english: Chilai Stood up with the help of Mark.
sentences.chinese: 在馬克的攙扶下，赤來站了起來。

sentences.english: Lee is the kid Mike carries into the Nurses office, right?
sentences.chinese: 李就是那個邁克攙扶着進醫務室的男生，對吧？

sentences.english: The patient got off the bed, supported by the nurse.
sentences.chinese: 那個病人在護士的攙扶下下了牀。

sentences.english: I am in of Xiaosong support sb with hand below, issued a bed, slowly pace to backyard.
sentences.chinese: 我在小宋的攙扶下，下了牀，慢慢地踱向後院。

sentences.english: On crutches and supported by a friend, slowly across the road.
sentences.chinese: 他拄着柺棍，由一個朋友攙扶着，慢慢的過馬路。

sentences.english: On shore, Chichester could not walk without help.
sentences.chinese: 奇切斯特上岸後，得由人攙扶才能行走。

sentences.english: He seemed to like it when Roger and I helped him.
sentences.chinese: 當我和羅傑攙扶他時，他似乎很開心。

sentences.english: On shore, Chichester could not walk without help.
sentences.chinese: 奇切斯特上岸後，得由人攙扶着才能行走。

sentences.english: The nurses helped the wounded soldiers into the hospital.
sentences.chinese: 護士們攙扶着傷病員走進醫院。

sentences.english: She can still come downstairs with assistance but she's very weak.
sentences.chinese: 在有人攙扶的情況下她還是能夠下樓的，但是很虛弱。

definition: unable to move freely/difficult to get about
to visit (a patient, prisoner etc)/to look inquiringly
to act with confusion/to be in a flurry/to be flustered
to faint/to swoon/to black out/to become unconscious
to enquire solicitously about sb's well-being (idiom)/to pamper
as if nothing had happened (idiom); calmly/nonchalantly
